qas.question: Who offered amnesty to the retreatig column?
Who dispatched a telegram to the supreme headquarters prohibiting the execution of prisoners of war?
In the final days of WWII in Yugoslavia, who were responsible for atrocities?
What did Tito offer to the retreating column?
Where were possible suspects transferred to?

context: In the final days of World War II in Yugoslavia, units of the <a2_0>Partisans<a2_0/> were responsible for atrocities after the repatriations of Bleiburg, and accusations of culpability were later raised at the Yugoslav leadership under <a1_0>Tito<a1_0/>. At the time, Josip Broz <a0_0>Tito<a0_0/> repeatedly issued calls for surrender to the retreating column, offering <a3_0>amnesty<a3_0/> and attempting to avoid a disorderly surrender. On 14 May he dispatched a telegram to the supreme headquarters Slovene Partisan Army prohibiting "in the sternest language" the execution of prisoners of war and commanding the transfer of the possible suspects to a <a4_0>military court.
